name: triple superphosphate production | triple superphosphate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23173/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of triple superphosphate (TSP), with 46% P2O5. Triple superphospate is a phosphorous fertiliser.;Triple superphosphate production involves the acidulation of rock phosphate with phosphoric acid. Two main methods exist: the two-step process and the slurry process. The former accounts for more than 75% of triple superphosphate production. The two-step process runs as follows: first a powder is made, where rock grinding uses the most energy, then this powder is granulated with steam. The slurry process uses phosphoric acid with a concentration of 42% P2O5 and has an energy requirement 20% lower than in the two-step process. This dataset represents triple superphosphate production with the slurry process.;The main data sources for this dataset are Fertilizers Europe (2014, 2016). Additional data sources are listed as follows.;References:;Kongshaug G. (1998): Energy Consumption and Greenhouse Gas Emissions in Fertilizer Production. IFA 20th July 1998;Davies J., Haglund C. (1999): Life Cycle Inventory of Fertiliser Production. SIK-Report No 654 1999. Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden.;Fertilizers Europe (2014): Average Emissions Year 2011. Fertilizers Europe Environmental report (internal).;Fertilizers Europe (2016): Carbon Footprint Calculator for Fertilizer Production. Specification. Version 2.1;Fertilizers Europe (2016): Average Emissions Year 2014. Fertilizers Europe Environmental report (internal). Used for updated energy and GHG emission in Carbon Footprint Calculator;Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

The activity includes all the raw and processed materials necessary to produce this product. Phosphate rock, phosphoric acid, electricity and steam are included. Direct emissions of fluorine and particulate matter to air and phosphorous to water are included.

The activity ends with the final product being ready for transportation at the production site.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Primary data were collected on fertiliser production for the year 2011. These data were based on annual average data for the year 2011.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The dataset is representative of triple superphosphate production Europe
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This datasets corresponds to the technology used in European fertiliser plants following the slurry process. The production of triple superphosphate involves the combination of phosphoric acid with phosphate rock, using steam.
